channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Jay Kuo
item.description: Wow. Forget the polls, these election results are really something else! Virginia, Ohio, Kentucky—all big wins, and all with a common theme that has Democrats strategizing and Republicans scrambling. Check it out in today’s piece. And yay! https://open.substack.com/pub/statuskuo/p/forget-the-polls-look-at-these-election?r=1zr8b&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=web

item.title: taz
item.description: Björn Höcke ist und bleibt ein Nazi. Das sagt auch die Hamburger Staatsanwaltschaft. 👉 https://taz.de/Verfahren-wegen-Beleidigung-eingestellt/!5968418/

item.title: Aram Sinnreich
item.description: "As for the purpose of Operation Star of David, like all dezinformatsiya it seems to have been to sow confusion and anxiety. The fact that the symbol could be either pro- or anti-Israeli made it all the more interesting: that way both sides would be suspicious."https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67360768

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Synapses and electric Fields: A two-way street. Cover of Cerebral CortexSee Pinotsis and Miller 2023. In vivo ephaptic coupling allows memory network formation. Cereb Cortex 33(17): 9877-9895
https://doi.org/10.1093/cercor/bhad251
#neuroscience

item.title: Louise Locock
item.description:
Do please spread the word that @chrischirp is looking for anonymous testimony from frontline #NHS staff on what it was really like during the early days of the pandemic.
As well as those caught up in the absolute horror of watching people die and being unable to help, there were so many other staff I know whose professional lives were turned upside down as they were drafted in to try to keep some level of care going for other urgent cases.
#NHSStaff #pandemic #covid
https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/PKH9MRT

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Ever wonder why anesthesia makes you unconscious? We figured out a piece of that puzzle.Anesthesia blocks sensation by cutting off communication within the cortex
https://picower.mit.edu/news/anesthesia-blocks-sensation-cutting-communication-within-cortex#Neuroscience

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Lice have been riding along with us on our journey for over 25 million years, recording our history along the way. For my column this week, I take a look inside their journal. Gift link: https://tinyurl.com/4xe6x4ks

item.title: BrianKrebs
item.description: @emilygorcenski just think: Your info is worth $120 a year to FB, and you've been giving it to them for free!

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Here's to the Ukraine and Moldava joining the EU.https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/08/european-commission-endorses-membership-talks-with-ukraine-and-moldovaI also think that the EU may represent a way to resolve the Palestinian question. Subsume everybody into a greater whole.

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Brief interlude for some righteoushttps://whatever.scalzi.com/2023/11/08/lets-talk-about-last-night-in-ohio/and soothinghttps://statuskuo.substack.com/p/forget-the-polls-look-at-these-electioncomment on yesterday's elections in the US.

item.title: beatnik
item.description: .@pluralistic spitting fire as usual, "In the end, the market-based pension makes you the sucker at the poker table, flushing your savings into a rigged casino that is firmly tilted in favor of finance barons and other eminently guillotineable plutocrats." https://pluralistic.net/2023/11/08/fiduciaries/

item.title: Ulrike Franke
item.description: This is so obvious and yet it’s not being done.“It will take at least two years to set up new production lines for tanks or missiles. Germany should now order all the material it needs to fully equip its armed forces, including reserves and consumables such as ammunition and spare parts.”https://dgap.org/de/forschung/publikationen/den-naechsten-krieg-verhindern

item.title: Timnit Gebru (she/her)
item.description:
Andreessen may have blocked me on twitter but it seems he sees eye to eye with all of us at DAIR! Cause we write:"If corporations are not allowed to exploit labor...they will not be able to proliferate harmful technologies as quickly — their market calculations would simply dissuade them from doing so."
https://www.noemamag.com/the-exploited-labor-behind-artificial-intelligence/

item.title: Erick Ratamero
item.description: losing my mind at people in science jamming LLMs into EVERYTHING without a single thought about all the extremely valid concerns people have raised about them again and again

item.title: Redish Lab
item.description: Looking forward to #sfn23 next week!We've got four posters, scattered across the days.1. Saturday PM VV (double V) 20: Clarifying proactive and reactive cognitive control deficits in psychosis via drift diffusion modeling2. Sunday PM NN 12: Probing the role of prefrontal cortex, hippocampus, and dorsolateral striatum on decision-making in complex spatial environments3. Sunday PM OO6: Hippocampal Representations in rats worried about being attacked by a threatening robot in the “robogator” approach-avoidance task4. Tuesday PM TT9 Network physiology metrics reveal a dynamic balance between excitatory and inhibitory functional connections in rodent prefrontal cortex during decision making Come check 'em out!I love #SFN. It's my favorite meeting. I'm looking forward to seeing both old and new friends on the poster floor!

item.title: Dr. jonny phd
item.description: whoopeldy boopeldy #SfN23 poster is done, now to sleep. neuromatchstodon right up there nestled next to the title <3

item.title: Tim Verstynen
item.description:
Folk going to #sfn23, check out my amazing student Kim Nestor’s poster. “Opposing engagement of cerebellar and basal ganglia networks with shifts of cortical network topology”Session Title: Effects of Executive Functions on Learning and Memory
Session Time: 11/14/2023 8:00:00 AM - 11/14/2023 12:00:00 PM
Presentation Time: Tue. Nov. 14, 2023 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM
Posterboard Number: VV9

item.title: Michele Banks
item.description: Going to #SfN #SfN23? Don't miss the #sciart booths! https://open.substack.com/pub/artologica/p/brainy-days #neuroscience

item.title: The Viking
item.description:
For those of you going to #sfn23 consider visiting my students' (Kaitlyn and Emils) poster:Sensorimotor control with biophysically-based thalamocortical spiking network model
K. J. HOESTEREY, *E. M. MATISS, M. L. LAPORTE, D. I. STANDAGE, G. BLOHMTue. Nov. 14, 2023 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM, PSTR349.15, board FF24

item.title: elle
item.description: when you saw only one set of footprints it was because a neurolink glitched and took out half your vision
